text: The men's 4 x 800 metres relay at the 2017 IAAF World Relays was held at the Thomas Robinson Stadium on 23 April. ==Records== Prior to the competition, the records were as follows: {| class="wikitable" |- |World record | (Joseph Mutua, William Yiampoy, Ismael Kombich, Wilfred Bungei) |7:02.43 | Brussels, Belgium |25 August 2006 |- |Championship record | (Duane Solomon, Erik Sowinski, Casimir Loxsom, Robby Andrews) |7:04.84 | Nassau, Bahamas |2 May 2015 |- |World Leading |University of Florida |7:18.11 | Gainesville, United States |1 April 2017 |- |African Record | (Joseph Mutua, William Yiampoy, Ismael Kombich, Wilfred Bungei) |7:02.43 | Brussels, Belgium |25 August 2006 |- |Asian Record | (Majed Saeed Sultan, Salem Amer Al-Badri, Abdulrahman Suleiman, Abubaker Ali Kamal) |7:06.66 | Brussels, Belgium |25 August 2006 |- |North, Central American and Caribbean record | (Jebreh Harris, Khadevis Robinson, Samuel Burley, David Krummenacker) |7:02.82 | Brussels, Belgium |25 August 2006 |- |South American Record |colspan=4 align=center|No official record |- |European Record | (Peter Elliott, Garry Cook, Steve Cram, Sebastian Coe) |7:03.89 | London, Great Britain |30 August 1982 |- |Oceanian record | (Josh Ralph, Ryan Gregson, Jordan Williamsz, Jared West) |7:11.48 | Nassau, Bahamas |24 May 2014 |} ==Schedule== {| class="wikitable" !
